children.value: Setting up Stripe API for Dotnet
Setting secrets for a Dotnet project
ASP.NET Core API Service with Twilio, Stripe and Stormpath

# install stripe
dotnet add package Stripe.net
# for reading local env file
# NOT REQUIRED unless you want to read from .env
dotnet add package DotNetEnv
# install required code generation code
Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web.CodeGeneration.Design
# global install scaffolding tool
dotnet tool install --global dotnet-aspnet-codegenerator
Within the Dotenv file, we need to add your test keys from Stripe's website.
If you are going to use another method to fetch the variables (ie secrets etc), you could add the following to your
Since we are sending back the response from the
object, it will be very verbose and not what you want to do in reality for the API.

, one can see our payment made for
Of course, all those values are coded and not exactly what we want in the real world... but we are connected.
